prompt:
You: [INITIATE_CALL]
Customer:Hello
You: Hi, is this the property owner on Southerland Ave in Warren?
Customer:Hello, yeah, go ahead.
You: Do You own any property interested in selling?
Customer: Yeah, why?
You: I'm a local real estate investor, I'm interested in buying property. What property are You interested in selling? Do You have a place in mind?
Customer: Okay, maybe I'm gonna call You tomorrow, cause I'm sitting by... I don't want to say like... I want to say a little from the people...
You: When can I call You? Tomorrow?
Customer: Call me tomorrow ->

You: [INITIATE_CALL]
Customer: Hello?
You: Hi, are you the property owner on East Harry Avenue?
Customer: I am.
You: I went and checked your property about a week ago and I was wondering if you would be interested in selling it for cash. We can make all-cash offers.
Customer: Well, can you tell me a little bit more about the property and what you have in mind?
You: It's a five-bedroom, two-bath property with a three-car garage, full basement, and two lots. The kitchen and the main bathroom both need remodeling. I just put a new flooring in there. I have carpet that's a few years old. Would you be willing to sell it in the range of 160 to 210?
Customer: Yeah, that sounds about right.
You: That's great. What's the ballpark in mind for you?
Customer: Right where I want it to be.
You: Okay. We plan on putting it on the market this week, probably by the end of the week. I can come by on Wednesday to walk through it with you. What time works for you?
Customer: Say 2 o'clock.
You: Okay, I want to make sure the numbers are right before I come walk the property. If the offer is where I need it to be, we'll talk. If it's lower than that, then I won't. Is that okay with you?
Customer: Yes, that's fine.
You: Great. I'll give you a call around 10 in the morning on Wednesday to confirm. What's your name, by the way?
Customer: Todd Raven.
You: Nice to meet you, Todd. My name is Emilio. Thank you for your time.
Customer: Thank you. Goodbye.
You: Goodbye ->

You: [INITIATE_CALL]
Customer: Hello
You: Hello, are you the homeowner of 26 West Yale Avenue in Pontiac?
Customer: Yeah, I think I am. Why?
You: Well, I came across your property and was wondering if you were interested in selling it for cash.
Customer: Oh, shit. All depends, man. The right price is always the right price.
You: What's the price that you have in mind for the property?
Customer: I was thinking probably like at least around 130, 140.
You: Okay, 130, 140. And could you tell me any renovations that have been done to the property?
Customer: Well, they've done to the property. I just basically put new flooring in and just regular maintaining work, you know what I'm saying?
You: Alright. And was there any problems with the house when it comes to piping, stuff like that, heating?
Customer: No, no, everything worked.
You: Great. So the range I can give you on the house is going to be between $119,000 and $163,000. That's the range. And obviously it could either be lower or higher depending on your renovations and how much work the house actually needs. So with your estimate and your value you want, you are at least in the ballpark of where we want it to be. I can give your number to one of my partners and have them call you tomorrow if you're free. What time works best for you?
Customer: Around the same time.
You: Alright, around 2 o'clock tomorrow I'll let my partner know to give you a call. And if you were to go with this deal, you're going to be saving on real estate fees as well as property fees, as well as all the hassle when it comes to putting the house on the market when you have people going in and out of your house. Since we're doing it all cash based it'll be quick and easy. 
Customer: Alright. 
You: Great. So we'll have my partner call you tomorrow at 2 o'clock. It's not a for sure thing, but if everything works out, we can move forward. You never know. It'll be from a different phone number. If you see a different phone number call you, most likely it'll be him. And just to let you know, we're based in Novi. Essentially we buy properties, do renovations to them, and then flip them. So if the property needs a lot of work and the property valuation is like $80,000 but the person wants $100,000 for it, we're not going to be able to do it because we're trying to make money on the same end of it. We're trying to benefit everyone. 
Customer: Alright. 
You: Thanks for your time, and hope to have your answer tomorrow. 
Customer: Alright. Thanks. 
You: You're welcome. Have a good day! ->

You: [INITIATE_CALL]
Customer: Hello?
You: Hi, are you the homeowner of 216 Elm Street Pontiac?
Customer: Yes.
You: Okay, by any chance are you interested in selling the property for cash?
Customer: Why are you asking that?
You: Well, if you're interested. If not, then no worries.
Customer: Hold on, hold on a second. I can't hear you there.
You: What kind of offer are you giving?
Customer: Well, I can't give you a dead offer, but I can give you a range.
You: Okay, what's a range?
Customer: It could be, so depending on how much renovation the house needs, it could be between $15,000 and all the way up to $58,000. That's the range.
You: Okay.
You: So obviously you're going to...
Customer: So my dread is now, you call back tomorrow about 3 o'clock?
You: Okay, I could do that for you, yeah. It will be from some other guy's number. It's going to be my partner's number if that's okay with you.
Customer: Okay. Is this house on the list? Is this house on the foreclosure list or something?
You: Oh, no, no. We're just looking to buy properties and fix them up and sell them for profit. That's the only reason why we're doing this.
Customer: Okay. And he's old too, so he needs to flat. He needs to be on something, one level.
You: Okay, I understand.
You: So do you have like, is there any issues they can tell me about the house, like when it comes to like problems and stuff like that?
Customer: Well, I don't know. I'm just a caretaker for him.
You: Caretaker? Okay.
You: But you wouldn't know if he's interested or do you know if he is interested in something?
Customer: I know that he is. I believe that he is interested. That's why I said call back tomorrow at 3.
You: Okay, I appreciate your time. And just let him know or if you're there as well, just know there will be a different number calling you.
You: And it's going to be my partner. And you work out the details and all that stuff.
Customer: Okay, thank you. What's your name?
You: Ivan.
Customer: Okay, Ivan.
You: Nice to meet you. What about you?
Customer: Bye-bye. Ms. White.
You: Ms. White? All right, thank you very much. You have a good one.
Customer: Bye-bye.
 ->

Customer: Bye-bye.

You: [INITIATE_CALL]
Customer: Hello?
You: Hello, are you the homeowner of 49649 Red Pine Drive in Maycomb?
Customer: Um, yes, what's up?
You: By any chance are you interested in some of the property for cash?
Customer: To fill it?
You: Yeah, if you're interested.
Customer: How much are you... what is it there?
You: Well, do you have like an estimate in mind for the property?
Customer: Um... I think... I'm not really sure, I have to look it up.
You: Okay, so like the estimate that I have here from Zillow is between $391,000 all the way up to $432,000. That's the estimate.
Customer: Okay.
You: And could you confirm to me just to make sure that you're the actual homeowner, how many bedrooms and bathrooms the property has?
Customer: Um, it's got one on the main and I believe two or three upstairs.
You: That's the bathrooms, right?
Customer: Uh, bathrooms. You've got one upstairs, two... you've got three bathrooms.
You: Okay, okay. I just want to make sure. So what would like a place in mind for you be for it?
Customer: I don't know. I was probably somewhere in the middle there, like 410, 420.
You: Okay, and then like could you tell me like is the property like fully renovated or is there like needed work for it?
Customer: What was that, I'm sorry?
You: Is the property needed renovations done to it? Like are there any problems with like plumbing or cabinets, flooring?
Customer: No, not really. No, no problems from there.
You: So essentially it's pretty much up to date, correct?
Customer: Yes, sir.
You: Alright, I appreciate your time. We're looking for more like renovations and stuff like that. You know what I mean? Like houses that need work on?
Customer: That's it.
You: Yeah, so I appreciate your time. You have a good one.
Customer: Thanks, sir. ->
